develop and raise students’ business awareness.

No Poverty.reason: The course focuses on job preparation and career planning, which are foundational for securing income and moving out of poverty, though poverty itself is not explicitly mentioned.

Part one will focus on the necessary skills for job hunting.
Students shall complete their own preparation tasks for their career plan through part one.

Quality Education.reason: The course is a form of higher education designed to equip students with advanced professional communication, public speaking, and job hunting skills, directly contributing to quality education.
evidence: The course aims to help students to achieve the following goals upon finishing the course.
be well-equipped with English language skills in job hunting
be able to deal with and communicate effectively in major business contexts.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: The course is fundamentally centered on preparing students for the job market through 'job preparation,' 'job hunting,' 'career plan,' 'Résumé and CV,' and 'Job Interview Skills.'

Students shall complete their own preparation tasks for their career plan through part one.

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: The course builds 'business awareness' and discusses 'current business issues,' which are tangentially related to industry and innovation, but this is not a primary focus.

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: A core competency is to 'understand and be able to identify... sustainability issues,' but the course content does not elaborate on this topic.
evidence: B. 理解與辨別道德、社會責任與永續議題(Students will understand and be able to identify ethics, social responsibility, and sustainability issues.)

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: The course teaches skills in 'negotiating' and 'crisis management,' which are relevant to conflict resolution and maintaining stability within business institutions.
evidence: negotiating, dealing with customer services, and crisis management.
Communicating at Work II: Crisis Management

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: The course develops skills in 'negotiating' and 'teamwork,' which are foundational for forming partnerships, although not explicitly for sustainable development goals.
evidence: E. 團隊合作與領導能力(Students will be able to work effectively in teams as well as develop leadership skills.)
